subject: is there a translation program to enter current english text to get quikscript?
msgSnippet: I think one of the ways to promote the use of Quikscript would be if folks got used to seeing it next to so-called regular English along with a little blurb
messageBody:
I think one of the ways to promote the use of Quikscript would be if
folks got used to seeing it next to so-called "regular" English
along with a little blurb of it's advantages over "regular" english
sort of like the printing of the earlier Shaw script for the George
Bernard Shaw book.

In particular, I'm thinking of the various Indymedia's around the
word www.indymedia.org

I tend to favor the adoption of Esperanto as an international
auxilliary language but support also the simplification of various
language writing systems to better reflect how they're spoken and to
increase literacy to a larger groups of people in a quicker period
of time. Thus it seems that Quikscript and it's predecesor Shavian
fit the bill.

What about previous attempts to modify english script such as
Deseret?

maybe offering a way for movies to be subtitled in Quickscript
and/or other means of introducing it into people's day to day lives
(models wearing t-shirts in Quickscript during Fashion Week?). I
know this is somewhat speculative, but it seems we've got to get
creative and figure out ways to promote these changes.

Feedback welcome.

Jesse Heiwa
satnordameriko@...
www.Esperanto.net
